results.title: The Idol = L'Idole
results.creator_credit: Samantha Lang, Marc Missonnier, Olivier Delbosc and Fidelite Productions
results.brief_description: Directed by Australian Samantha Lang (The Monkey’s mask), this is a tale of two different souls who find solace in each other - and a kind of obsession. Set in Paris, France in an apartment block with a winding staircase that binds the people who live there. In an empty apartment opposite the elderly resident of Chinese origin called Zao (James Hong) arrives the beautiful and melodramatic Sarah (Leelee Sobieski), a young theatre actress from Australia. Sarah wants to feign a suicide to scandalise her relationship with her married lover but until she does the deed Zao asks that he may cook for her. Together they face the prospect of the end of life, love and sexual yearning - and an enjoyment of good food. Based on the novel “A L’Heure Dite” by Michelle Tourneur.

results.title: The Host Monogama
results.brief_description:
Determination will get you anywhere but tread carefully.

This short film was created by students of the Centre for Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) at RMIT University in Melbourne. Featuring hand-illustrated characters and settings, animated using a paper cutout technique.

results.title: The Icicle thief
results.creator_credit: Maurizio Nichetti, Bambu and Aries Film
results.brief_description: In his ingenious comedy, Nichetti has takena wide-eyed look at Italian cinema, past and present, and has staggered back from the vision, his mind brimming with invention. On one hand, there’s Italy’s hallowed neo-realist past; grainy, black-and-white postwar images full of stubbled, unemployed fathers, sacrficial mothers and brave bustling priests. On the other, there are the television shows that “present” these films: a wasteland of lofty critics, only too willing to interpret a director’s deepest motives and intentions- even to the director himself. Nichetti has created a hilarious movie that mixes the world of cinema and television into a comic masterpiece.

results.title: Helium
results.brief_description: Throughout the year, thousands of balloons are released as part of sporting events. But where do they end up? Go on an adventure as one such group of balloons band together to overcome the dangers of the world beyond the stadium.

results.title: Cog
results.brief_description: A 2D digitally composited animation, with a distinctive 3D look. The mechanical, metalloid, surreal environment, as well as the characters, were created from real life cut-outs (from photographs) of everyday objects. COG is a parable about the beauty of life being ground down by an industrial society.

results.title: The Iced hopes of Dr Calastein
results.creator_credit: Bruce Currie, Hobart Hughes and Sydney Filmmakers Co-operative
results.brief_description: Calestein returns to his underground laboratory to continue work on his beloved virus. A day not unlike any other and yet today is different. Somehow things have gone to far, and those outside and above think its time to have a few words with Dr Calestein.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bruce Currie, Hobart Hughes and Sydney Filmmakers Co-operative
